text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Tuesday:
- The European Commission and the Netherlands decided to take bilateral negotiations with Switzerland on strengthening economic links off today's EU foreign ministers' agenda.

- The loser house of parliament voted to make it easier for foreign investors to buy real estate in Switzerland if used for industrial and service sector projects. The measure now moves to the upper house.
- Private organisations plan to open a museum of contemporary art in Vaduz, Lichtenstein.
- The upper house of parliament voted in favour of a 561 million Swiss franc investment programme. The lower house will discuss the programme today.

- The Zurich local government decided that every third state employee who leaves the administration will not be replaced. By doing so, the local government can axe 2,300 jobs within the next 12 months.

- The lower house of parliament decided not to hand out 413 million Swiss francs in federal subsidies to health insurance policy holders. Each person in Switzerland would have received 60 Swiss francs by the end of the year.
- U.S. computer manufacturer Silicon Graphics plans to create some additional 260 jobs within the next five years in its European manufacturing plant based near Neuchatel, the group told journalists.
